intro: Tapeinosperma pauciflorum, commonly known as the few-flowered tapeinosperma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. Its leaves are typically opposite and elliptical in shape. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in forested areas.
